definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Can they feel the  crackle of  electricity in the wind?
sentences.chinese: 他們能否感受到風中的電光火石？

sentences.english: The tube holds the flint stone and the plate (?) the top of the inner case.
sentences.chinese: 機械手將火石管和彈簧片安裝在內膽上。

sentences.english: Then he took out his tinderbox and struck the flint.
sentences.chinese: 於是他拿出火絨箱，並敲擊打火石。

sentences.english: But there's one problem. We need a piece of flint.
sentences.chinese: 馬特說，“但有一個問題，我們需要一塊打火石。”

sentences.english: Why do you need such a small and unimportant flint?
sentences.chinese: 你爲什麼要這麼一小塊不值錢的火石呢？

sentences.english: Can they feel the crackle of electricity in the wind?
sentences.chinese: 他們能否感遭到風外的電光火石？

sentences.english: It is the flint from my grandmother, so I want to get it.
sentences.chinese: 那塊火石是從我奶奶那裏傳下來的，所以我想得到它。

sentences.english: But thinking he had said too much about the flints , he was afraid to speak now.
sentences.chinese: 他覺得他扯了那麼一通打火石的事，現在有點害怕。

sentences.english: They would strike a spark off the friction between flint and steel and catch a tiny piece of tinder alight.
sentences.chinese: 火石與鋼摩擦後產生火花並點燃一小片火絨。

sentences.english: After his friends all went back, he hit the flint twice.
sentences.chinese: 在所有的朋友走了以後，他擦了兩次火石。

definition: tinder/source of a fire/inflammable material/(fig.) spark (of a revolution etc)
to make a fire/to light a fire
